Oklahoma_City.Overholser Mansion:
The Overholser Mansion is a mansion in Oklahoma City built in 1903.


== History ==
The mansion was built for Henry Overholser, considered to be the "father of Oklahoma City" by many, and his socialite wife Anna Murphy Overholser, and is considered to be Oklahoma City's first mansion. Overholser bought the land for the purpose of building a residence in 1901 and, when built, the mansion was located away from the city center and surrounded by farmland.
